title: COVID Blood Processing for scRNAseq

source.description:
Create the following DPBS Solution-EDTA in a bottle of DPBS by using the table below:
ABCD
1ComponentVolume (mL)Starting Conc.Final Conc.
2DPBS474-
3FBS25100%5%
4EDTA10.5 M1 mM

ABCD
1ComponentVolume (mL)Starting Conc.Final Conc.
2DPBS474-
3FBS25100%5%
4EDTA10.5 M1 mM
Place sample box into biosafety cabinet.
Remove samples from the box and from the containment bags, discard bags, spray sample containers with >70% ethanol and wipe down.
Record the total volume of whole blood to be processed in mL.

Spin the whole blood
in the anti-coagulant tubes and remove the plasma layer to cryovials. Be sure to not remove any red blood cells with the plasma. Add the same volume to all cryovials.
Record number of vials: __________ and the volume per vial __________ mL.

source.body: NOTE: Ensure that cryovials are decomtaminated prior to removal from the biosafety cabinet.

source.description: Add the same volume of DPBS Solution-EDTA as removed plasma back to the blood tube. Pipette to mix.

Add
directly to the blood tube. Pipette to mix.

Inclubate samples at
for
.

Transfer sample to a 50 mL tube and dilute up to
with DPBS Solution-EDTA solution.

Aliquot
to a 50 mL tube.

Using the slow setting on the pipette gun, gently layer the blood/DPBS Solution-EDTA mixture on top of the
. Take extra care not to disturb the blood-ficoll interface while layering. Disturbing the interface excessively prevents the mononuclear cells from becoming a clean layer.

Spin for
with no brake, 4 acceleration.

source.body: NOTE: Centrifuge should be pre-warmed to .

source.description: Remove the mononuclear cell layer from each tube and transfer to a new 50 mL tube. Take extra care to avoid pulling cells from the ficoll layer (underneath the mononuclear cell layer) as this typically contains a lot of granulocytes. Pulling from the plasma layer is not an issue.

Top PBMC with cold DPBS Solution-EDTA to
(ensure at least 2-3 volumes are added) and centrifuge the cell suspension(s) for
.

(Platelet Spin) Discard the supernatant, top tube to
with cold DPBS Solution-EDTA, and centrifuge the cell suspension for
.

Remove the supernatant (caution: pellet may be loose), and resuspend the cell pellet in
.

Add
,
, and
to a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube, incubate for
at
.

Add
to the samples and incubate
,
, and protect from light.

Aliquot
to the well of a NC-Slide A8 and count on the NC-3000.
Record number and viability below, calculate total cells:
cell number: __________cells/mL, __________% viable

source.title: Division of Sample for Analysis and Freeze-down

source.description:
Aliquot up to 2 x 107 cells to a 5 mL Falcon Round-Bottom tube and place
for subsequent sample clean-up (next section).

source.title: Division of Sample for Analysis and Freeze-down

source.description:
Freeze down up to 1 x 108 cells in approximately 1 x 107 aliquots (
each) using Cryostor CS10 Medium, a Mr. Frosty, and a
freezer.
Record the number of vials frozen: __________ and the cells per cryovial frozen: _________.

Follow the appropriate 10X protocol (Chromium Next GEM Single Cell 3’ Reagent Kits v3.1 User Guide – Rev D) for encapsulation of cells from the airway sample.

materials.name: Gibco™ DPBS no calcium no magnesium
Thermo Scientific™ Nunc™ 50mL Conical Sterile Polypropylene Centrifuge Tubes
Gibco™ Fetal Bovine Serum qualified Australia

description: This protocol describes the isolation of lymphocytes and pan-mononuclear cells from human whole blood for scRNAseq analysis.
